abstract.shortdesc: Maintenance steps for rebootinga RADOS Gateway node.

body.p: Peform the following steps to reboot the RADOS Gateway node (irrespective of the Rados Gateway node being installed on dedicated cluster nodes or monitor cluster nodes or controller nodes)

p.note: If you are rebooting all RADOS Gateway nodes, reboot one node at a time (so that the service is available during reboot).

ol.li: Wait for the node to become ssh-able and allow an additional minimum of five minutes for the node to settle.
Start the services on the nodecd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts hlm-start.yml --limit <radosgw-node>

Verify the status of all services on the node:cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts hlm-status.yml --limit <radosgw-node>
It is important that you do not begin the reboot procedure for another Rados Gateway node until the reboot of the previous Rados Gateway node has been completed successfully (i.e. the hlm-status playbook has completed without error).
